explosives.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive properties

flammable_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

oxidizing_gases.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

gases_under_pressure.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

flammable_liquids.rationale: The flash point is 43degC (c.c.) (ICSC, 2003) which is classified into Category 3. Classified into Class 3 and Packing Group III (UN#2238 (chlorotoluene)) (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods)

flammable_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_reactive_substances.rationale: Containing no chemical groups with explosive or self-reactive properties

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2238 (chlorotoluene))

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

self_heating_substances.rationale: Test methods applicable to liquid substances are not available

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: Containing no metals or metalloids (B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At)

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing chlorine (but not oxygen and fluorine), with the chlorine bound to carbon and hydrogen (but not to other elements)

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Classified as "liquid" according to GHS definition

corrosive_to_metals.rationale: Classified into Class 3 (UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, UN#2238 (chlorotoluene))

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: Based on the LD50 value calculated from the testing data of rat LD50 (oral route) of 3,227mg/kg (SIDS (2004)), 3,860mg/kg (SIDS (2004)) and 3,900mg/kg (MOE Risk Assessment vol.3 (2004)).

acute_toxicity_inhalation_gas.rationale: Due to the fact that the substance is "liquid" according to the GHS definition and inhalation of its gas is not expected.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Because the rat LC50 value of 7,119ppm (SIDS (2004)) exceeded the saturated vapour concentration (4,510ppm) under a saturated vapour pressure of 456Pa (25degC), the substance was considered as "mist exposure."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit skin irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD Test Guideline 404 (SIDS (2004)): Mild irritation and erythema are observed.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rabbit eye irritation tests performed in accordance with OECD Test Guideline 405 (SIDS (2004)): Conjunctival hyperemia and chemosis are observed, both of which disappear within 7 days of exposure.

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Based on the description in the report on guinea pig skin sensitization tests (SIDS (2004)) - "2-Chlorotoluene, tested in accordance with OECD Guideline 406, is not sensitizing to the skin of guinea pigs."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Based on the absence of data on multi-generation mutagenicity tests and germ cell mutagenicity tests in vivo and negative data on somatic cell mutagenicity tests in vivo (chromosome aberration tests), described in SIDS (2004).

toxic_to_reproduction.rationale: Due to the absence of existing classification and enough information for use in classification.

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement: Suspected of damaging fertility or the unborn child
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: Based on the description in the report on rat teratogenicity tests (MOE Risk Assessment vol. 4 (2005), MOE Risk Assessment vol. 3 (2004), SIDS (2004)): Congenital malformations (brachydactylia) are observed in the embryo at dosing levels toxic to parental animals.

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs (central nervous system) May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "deterioration of the general state (associated with sedation and respiratory failure), coma" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-66 (2002)), "loss of coordination, narcotic influence, stooping position" (ACGIH (7th, 2001)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney, central nervous system, liver)
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Based on the evidence from animal studies including "color fading and swelling of the kidneys, depression of the central nervous system, adverse effects on the liver" (CERI Hazard Data 2001-66 (2002)). The effects on experimental animals were observed at dosing levels within the guidance value ranges for Category 2.

acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 1 from 48 hours EC50=0.70mg/L of the crustacea (Daphnia magna) (MOE eco-toxicity tests of chemicals (2000) and others.).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Very toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Although acute toxicity is Category 1 and bio-accumulation is low (BCF=112(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data, )), since there was no rapidly degrading (the decomposition by BOD: 0%(Existing Chemical Safety Inspections Data)), it was classified into Category 1.
